channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple will add 20,000 U.S. jobs amid threat from Trump tariffs
item.description: The company said Monday that it plans to spend $500 billion domestically over the next four years.

item.title: Hopes Fade for Workers Trapped for Days in Tunnel in India
item.description: Local officials have been unable to make contact with eight people after wall of silt and water caused the ceiling to collapse.

item.title: Stripe’s billionaire Collison brothers say remote work solves the ‘two-body problem’ faced by working couples
item.description: Stripe president John Collison cautioned against RTO mandates, saying they catered to the “bottom 5% of the company.”

item.title: Pope Francis, in Critical Condition, Is ‘Resting’ in Hospital, Vatican Says
item.description: Francis is being treated for pneumonia, a complex infection and kidney problems that have left him in critical condition.

item.title: When Warren Buffett bought an obscure RV maker he promised to pay the CEO whatever he asked—it’s not a tactic Buffett recommends, but the gamble paid off
item.description: Warren Buffett says not many people will know the name Pete Liegl, a "one-of-a-kind" founder and CEO who contributed billions to the Berkshire Hathawa...

item.title: Apple to Invest $500 Billion in U.S. as Trump Tariffs Loom
item.description: The company pledged the multibillion-dollar investment over the next four years and said it would create 20,000 jobs. The Texas facility is set to ope...

item.title: Sequins, Merch, Chain Saws: Trump’s Return to CPAC
item.description: Inside the pro-Trump scene at the yearly conference.

item.title: Pope Francis, in Critical Condition, Is ‘Resting’ in Hospital, Vatican Says
item.description: Francis is being treated for pneumonia, a complex infection and kidney problems that have left him in critical condition.

item.title: As Trump Courts Putin, China’s Leader Xi Emphasizes Close Ties With Russia
item.description: The Chinese and Russian leaders reaffirmed their relationship in a video call on Monday, an apparent rebuff to the idea that the Trump administration ...

item.title: Germany Election Results Maps: How Conservatives Regained Power
item.description: Maps show how every district in Germany voted. The conservative Christian Democrats have won the most seats while the far-right AfD placed second.

item.title: Hamas Official Expresses Reservations About Oct. 7 Attack on Israel
item.description: Mousa Abu Marzouk, the head of Hamas’s foreign relations office, said he would not have supported such an attack on Israel had he known of the devasta...

item.title: Hamas Official Expresses Reservations About Oct. 7 Attack on Israel
item.description: Mousa Abu Marzouk, the head of Hamas’s foreign relations office, said he would not have supported such an attack on Israel had he known of the devasta...

item.title: Roberta Flack, Virtuoso Singer-Pianist Behind ‘Killing Me Softly,’ Dies at 88
item.description: With majestic anthems like “Killing Me Softly” and “The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face,” Ms. Flack, a former schoolteacher, became one of the most wi...

item.title: Steve Jobs didn’t take Warren Buffett’s financial advice to buy back Apple stock, and it says a lot about his leadership style
item.description: Warren Buffett gave Steve Jobs four options of what to do with his cash pile.

item.title: Microsoft cancels leases for AI data centers, analyst says
item.description: The move may reflect concerns about whether it’s building more AI computing than it will need over the long term, TD Cowen said in a report.
